title: Freddie Blay Should Not Dare Us; Well Storm Head Quarters Bolga Bulldogs
text:
Politics | 23 October 2015 11:47 CET Freddie Blay Should Not Dare Us; We’ll Storm Head Quarters – Bolga Bulldogs By Kasapafmonline.com/Ghana 
Opposition Vigilate group, Bolga Bull-dogs has issued stern warning to the party’s first Vice chairman, Freddie Blay, asking him not to dare hold any National Executive Committee meeting as planned today. 
“We’ll not condone illegality in the party;why should he convene a meeting while Chairman Afoko is not out of jurisdiction- We’re storming the Head quarters today to make sure the meeting doesn’t come on,” the commander of the group, Reginald Yussif Ayikambe told sit-in host Yaa serwaa Akoto on Anopa Kasapa on Kasapa 102.3 FM Friday. 
The group alleged that such moves are testament to the suspicion that the party is bent on sidelining Northerners within the party. 
But reacting to the development on Kasapa 102.3 FM, Ayikambe observed that the party risked depleting its numerical force, if it do not refrain from the divisive mentality. 
“As we speak now, there is no seat for us in the Upper West region, how can we go on like this?- he questioned to condemn the confusion in the party. 
Meanwhile, Party Chairman, Paul Afoko has publicly flayed Freddie Blay for calling an emergency National Executive Committee meeting without his knowledge. 
He’s insisted Blay has no right to call for such meeting when he is within the jurisdiction. 
Below is the full statement: 
PRESS STATEMENT 
FROM THE CHAIRMAN OF THE NEW PATRIOTIC PARTY 
TO ALL MEDIA HOUSES 
DATE: 23RD OCTOBER 2015 
It has come to my notice that an emergency meeting of the National Executive Committee of the party has been called for today Friday the 23rd of October 2015 at 10am at the Party’s Headquarters. I hereby state categorically that no such meeting of NEC has been scheduled and that members should disregard any such notices they might have received. 
I am informed that the said meeting is being called by the Party’s 1st Vice Chairman, Mr. Freddie Blay. By the provisions of our constitution, Mr. Freddie Blay has no vested authority to sanction such a meeting, especially when I the chairman, the constitutionally mandated person to call and preside over such meetings have not authorized Mr. Blay to call any meeting. 
I wish to further state that I am in the jurisdiction, available and capable of discharging my constitutionally mandated functions as chairman of the NPP. 
I also wish to serve notice, and notice is hereby served that the meeting called by Mr. Blay is an illegality and a breach of our party’s constitution. 
Thank you very much. Long Live the NPP! 
Signed
